reviews.review_msg: He is a well-respected professor that has an expansive knowledge of film. Lectures are sometimes boring, but you could tell he had a true passion for teaching the art of film. The assignments are relatively simple for the class and TAs give good feedback. The midterm and final are both online and can be done anytime from 9am-11:59pm.

Great professor and the TAs marked very fairly. Only a few assignments and they were all easy to be honest. The lectures were boring but you get to watch a film after the lecture and most of them were okay. The midterm and final were online and only multiple choice since the class size was 300.

Had a great time in his class. the lectures were kinda boring and the movies werent the best but chill class nonetheless. The prof is great explains the terminology for the course well. fair exams and assignments. assignment grading is fully dependant on TAs but they do a good job for the most part. Overall had a good time with this course.
farshid is a really kind professor who cares about his students. even though the course wasnt great, he is a good and helpful professor.

taking ca135 with farshid was one of the best classes ive had. though the grades are based on 2 exams, 1 term paper, and 2 short papers. it is obvious that he teaches because film is his passion and he wants to share that. he is very kind, and though lectures may run a little late or slides get repetitive, his attitude overpowers that!!
This professor is so nice and the exam questions are straight forward. The marking for the writing is fair and the comments are clear.
Farshid was reasonable when it came to everything, one big thing was that class half the time would run at least 15 mins over. He clearly has a passion for film, but it was pretty annoying

Farshad was a very reasonable when it came to the weightings of assignments and clearly has a passion for film. My big annoyance with him was he just couldn't stop talking, about half the time class would run at least 10 mins over, and there were MANY LONG readings (just hope you have a chill TA and you'll be fine)

Very dry lectures and bland slides. Try to stay awake. Don't bother trying to get creative on the essays- I got my best grades on papers that were basically a list of techniques used in a given scene. Exams are easy. Film choices were okay, nothing special. The textbook is also painfully boring. Avoid if you still have a spark of life left in you.

A lot of the bad reviews on here can be chalked up to horrible TA marking! Dr. Kazemi is a great prof with a genuine passion for what he teaches. Super kind, understanding, and approachable (unlike TAs). Ultimately, the experience you're getting is dictated by if you're actually interested in the material or if you're taking it as a "GPA booster".

Lectures were incredibly boring, slides were very text heavy. Films were decent but you could honestly watch them from home and read the textbook. Essays were marked fairly and good feedback was provided. The prof seemed like a great person, very friendly but didn't teach very well. Wouldn't recommend this course with this prof.

Class has 3 essays and one exam. Exam has a lot of references to things he says in class, so beware. Prof is super sweet, very accommodating and TAs provide ample feedback so you can improve your writing.

One of the worst classes I have ever taken. Will do my best to avoid Kazemi in the future. Do yourself a favor and drop this class. Barely any assignments and the grading is brutal and exams are such cheapshots. Trust the poor reviews.

Terrible, seemingly aimless and long class with a terrible prof. Useless rambling lectures, harsh T.A marking. Exams despite being open book are unfair and subjectively marked. Exams on random useless info that doesn't even seem to be discussed in readings or in class and seem to be subjectively marked. Not a GPA booster, avoid this class.

Good person but not the best teacher -- just reads off wordy PPT during lectures and is often unprepared for class. Also tests on things that he briefly mentions during his lectures. TA's also mark very hard without providing clear feedback.

Dr. Kazemi is one of the best professors I have had. His passion for cinema shows through the way he teaches, and his excitement makes lectures more enjoyable. First half of class is lecture and the second half is a movie screening. Readings, lectures and movies are well connected and diverse. I would highly recommend taking this course with him!

He completely fails to lecture without reading verbatim from his slides as if it's the first time he's read it himself. Includes extraneous details on the midterm or final that he mentioned off-hand in a lecture without noting that it was of any importance for exams or any note of it on Canvas. Provides next to no time for breaks despite 3 hr lec.
Absolute legend watch grinch before Christmas and the final was simply making a movie just like pulp fiction

honestly, u can tell he's super passionate and definitely cares about his students he's very accommodating. the lectures are pretty chill, first half are usually dry cuz its all history stuff but the second half is watching a film so definitely not a bad way to spend a 3hr lecture on a weeknight.
Communicates quite well and the workload is quite light, grading wise clear.

Has questions on the exam that includes random fun facts that the professor talks about, which no one would remember the answers because it is a 3 hour course mostly consisted of movie watching. Very petty behavior.
He is passionate about movies and very kind. If you enjoy films, then this course is perfect for you.
Clearly very passionate about what he teaches. Lecturing skills could use some work though. The class is very easy if you like films. Lectures are super drying and boring though.

One of the worst classes I have ever taken. The lectures were the most dry thing in the world, the textbooks were boring and dull to read through. There were only 3 assessments to do and the TAs gave horrible  and generic feedback. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE!
Really chill guy, really does have a passion for film. Just that lectures can be extremely dry when talking about the history of things. Films watched in class were interesting too.
great professor, really passionate for what he's doing. if you pay attention you'll enjoy the class.
Pretty knowledgeable prof and very caring about students. Would recommend  to other students. He makes classes fun and enjoyable too. Class average was a b+

Definitely a caring and passionate professor, but maybe a little bit disorganized. Lectures often go past the three hour time slot that is given due to movie lengths and during the midterm he didn't print enough exams. Despite this, I found the class really easy. Most of the material is textbook based and the grading is very fair for an intro class

Dr. Kazemi is very passionate about cinema and provides lots of examples and video clips to help understanding of concepts. Lecture slides were boring and he always started the films late, so the class always went way over time. This was frustrating, but the class was still enjoyable. Textbook was brutally long, though.
He is a very caring man. Not the best lecturer and there was a lot of reading to do but the assignments were interesting

He was a very kind and caring person, especially towards his students. His lectures were kind of dry, but the short videos were relatively interesting. Some of the movies were interesting, but some were rather dark. I would have enjoyed more selections from the comedic genre. 2 scene analyses and one paper that were pretty straightforward
